Class Validator

  • java.lang.Object
    • Validator

  • public class Validator
extends java.lang.Object
    Prompts for and then validates console based input. Based in part on code from Murach's Java SE 6 by Joel Murach, et. al.

      • getLine

        public static java.lang.String getLine(java.util.Scanner sc,
                                       java.lang.String prompt)
        Prompts the user with a message and then retrieves what the user types as a String.
        Parameters:
        sc - The user input
        prompt - String providing context for the user before input is entered

      • getLine

        public static java.lang.String getLine(java.util.Scanner sc,
                                       java.lang.String prompt,
                                       java.lang.String regex)
        Prompts the user with a message and then retrieves what the user types as a String. The regex is a String that contains a regular expression. The message repeats until the user enters a correct value. For example, a regular expression of "^[qadl]$" would require a "q" or an "a" or a "d" or an "l" to be entered. A regular expression of "^quit|add|delete|list$" would require one of the listed words to be entered. A regular expression of "^\d\d-\d\d-\d\d\d\d$" would require a date in the form of "11-01-2014" to be entered.
        Parameters:
        sc - The user input
        prompt - String providing context for the user before input is entered
        regex - A regular expression for comparing entered values against a designated format
        Returns:
        returns String s, the contents of which change based on outcome of if statement

      • getInt

        public static int getInt(java.util.Scanner sc,
                         java.lang.String prompt)
        Prompts the user with a message and then retrieves the user input as an integer.
        Parameters:
        sc - user input
        prompt - String providing context to user for desired input
        Returns:
        Returns an integer "i", if sc was found to be valid, the "i" will be returned, containing the contents of sc

      • getInt

        public static int getInt(java.util.Scanner sc,
                         java.lang.String prompt,
                         int min,
                         int max)
        Prompts the user for input and retrives input as an integer, then compares user input against a minimum and maximum value
        Parameters:
        sc - User input, stored as an integer
        prompt - String providing context to the user before input is entered
        min - Lower value that user input is compared against, if input is lower than "min" an error is generated
        max - Upper value that user input is compared against, if input is greater than "max" an error is generated
        Returns:
        So long as user input is within "min" and "max" integers, "i" is returned, containing the user input integer

      • getLong

                           java.lang.String prompt)
        Prompts the user with a message and then retrieves what the user types as an integer.
        Parameters:

        prompt -
        Returns:

      • getLong

        public static long getLong(java.util.Scanner sc,
                           java.lang.String prompt,
                           long min,
                           long max)
        Prompts the user for input and retrives input as a long integer, then compares user input against a minimum and maximum value
        Parameters:
        sc - User input, stored as an integer
        prompt - String providing context to the user before input is entered
        min - Lower value that user input is compared against, if input is lower than "min" an error is generated
        max - Upper value that user input is compared against, if input is greater than "max" an error is generated
        Returns:
        So long as user input is within "min" and "max" long integers, "i" is returned, containing the user input long iteger

      • getDouble

        public static double getDouble(java.util.Scanner sc,
                               java.lang.String prompt)
        Prompts the user for input and retrives input as a double, then compares user input against a minimum and maximum value
        Parameters:
        sc - User input
        prompt - String providing context to the user before input is entered
        Returns:
        Returns variable d of data type double, containing user input (if found to be valid). Otherwise d contains "0"

      • getDouble

        public static double getDouble(java.util.Scanner sc,
                               java.lang.String prompt,
                               double min,
                               double max)
        Prompts the user for input and retrives input as a double, then compares user input against a minimum and maximum value
        Parameters:
        sc - User input, stored as a double if found to be valid
        prompt - String providing context to the user before input is entered
        min - Lower value that user input is compared against, if input is lower than "min" an error is generated
        max - Upper value that user input is compared against, if input is greater than "max" an error is generated
        Returns:
        So long as user input is within "min" and "max", variable d is returned, containing the user input double
